cert_ejpt_desc: Junior pentesting certification covering networks, Linux, Windows and basic techniques.
cert_oscp_desc: Highly-regarded advanced pentesting certification covering exploitation and privilege escalation.
cert_intro_paragraph1: My training is self-taught; I dedicate at least four hours every day to study, including practice, review, reading, and new learning. I have trained with academies such as Marcelo Vázquez's (Savitar, Hack4u) and Martín Frías's (Hixec), investing hours of practice and learning with platforms like Hack The Box (HTB), TryHackMe, Pentester Academy, among others. HTB in particular stands out for its sites and resources, even free ones, that train people in cybersecurity and ethical hacking from the basics to labs that simulate real environments.
cert_intro_paragraph2: I do not yet hold official certifications, but one of the most recognized (at the junior level) and accessible ones ($250 USD, roughly 750,000–1,000,000 Colombian pesos) is the eJPT, which I plan to obtain in 2026.
